website_summaries.verdict: The exercise-focused, water-resistant JVC HA-ETR40 earphones deliver crisp audio in a secure-fitting design.
pros: Clean, crisp audio performance with articulate bass response
Excellent fit with substantial passive noise reduction
cons: Can be overly bright on certain genres

customer_reviews.title: Fairly durable and good sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like to invest in headphones that are durable and these have lasted me a year before one of the sides has started to go silent. So they're better than your cheap ones that break in a week and the sound quality is otherwise good for the cost. The hook keeps the buds in well (which is a fear of mine with in ear headphones which often fall out) but the disadvantages of the in ear design are still very apparant (ear wax impaction)
customer_reviews.author: neil

customer_reviews.title: Good running headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are good running headphones never have fallen out whilst doing exercise for me. Also these are the first in ear headphones that stay in for me properly which I'm very pleased with. I find the comfortable enough to wear few hours which is good. Pleased with the headphones overall.
customer_reviews.author: Connor R.

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound but good for running
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is thin particularly with vocals. As this is an in-ear, noise isolation is good. Comfortable and firm fit stays in place when running and it is waterproof. The Pioneer SE-E721-K may have been a better choice although this is only splashproof I think.  although a bit too expensive at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: jayson31

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I thought the bass was low at first but it depends on which rubber ear pieces are used. The ones that allow a little outside sound in have less bass. Switching to standard pieces fixed the issue and this is noted in the leaflet that comes with the headphones. Good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Excellent except ear fitting which leaves ear sore after a while
customer_reviews.text: Everything is excellent except the red rubber that holds the earphone on your ear is only 1 size and can make my ear sore after wearing for long time. It's a little tiny bit big although I can fit it in my ear. For the price it's good. I would recommend. They do returns so worth the purchase to try.
customer_reviews.author: MrNaz

customer_reviews.title: Fine for speech based content, but lack any kind of bass for music
customer_reviews.text: Thought I'd try these for general and sports use given positive reviews from others. Unfortunately they just lack any richness and bass. Probably fine for speech based content, but not for music. Given the price, I'm disappointed and have had better sound from previous £10-15 purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good earphones. They fit comfortably and do not come out while running. Sound quality is ok. Useful to have two options for length. The clip is a bit fiddly.
customer_reviews.author: M R Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.text: Fit nicely and very comfortable but microphone/remote button has stopped working after just two weeks. Also slightly frustrating that you cant control volume via the remote button which is a function I've found useful whilst running on different headphones
customer_reviews.author: Robert Jones

customer_reviews.title: Easily broken, flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: Really flimsy. The wire broke off where it attaches to the remote control after a couple weeks. Otherwise the headphones are ok, the sound is good enough but not great. The ear piece works really well and does not fall out when running.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get them.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing set of earphones. They stay in my ear running and at the gym. Rate them highly. Sound is legit, too.
customer_reviews.author: Mr C Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good quality sound but will not stay in ear
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for headphones which will stay in during sport stay away from these. I have tried every combination of earbud size and every position of the collar and they still keep falling out. because there is a joint to enable them to be short or long they are unneccessarily heavy and pull on the buds, even with the clip attached it still pendulums annoyingly. The pause button works on my ipod but the extra weight of it makes it not a worthwhile addition. Unfortunately I am still looking for a sports headphone which will actually stay in my ear.
customer_reviews.author: William Bowman

customer_reviews.title: They don't fall out!
customer_reviews.text: Sound is good, and they stay in my ears when i run. all i wanted :)
customer_reviews.author: MattA

customer_reviews.title: ... ever stayed in my ears while running which was great for about 2 months
customer_reviews.text: They are the only pair of earphones that have ever stayed in my ears while running which was great for about 2 months. I have gone through 2 pairs and both broke with one earphone stopping working. Real shame.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: JVC HA-ETR40 Splashproof Sporty In-Earphone with one-button mic/remote - Black (International Version)
product_meta.description: Garantie L'étroite collaboration entre High-Tech Place et ses fournisseurs nous permet de vous proposer une garantie commerciale de 1 an.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars51 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
